titleStmt.title: Letter, William Randolph Hackley in Yazoo City, Miss., to his wife 1865 Nov. 27

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, William Randolph Hackley in Yazoo City, Miss., to his wife 1865 Nov. 27

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Yours of the 13 recd on the 25th I am sorry you do not take more exercise you should go out every day when the weather permits and take C with you no ones health can be good without out of Door Exercise I walk every afternoon and climb the hills so as to take as much as possible in the short time from 4 till Dusk the weather is delightful regular Indian summer. speaking of Indians I saw several men in town Saturday but they were dressed in coast and trousers and did not look Indian they were Choctaws a number of whom still remain in this state they are noted for never having fought the whites and than the girls saw in New Orleans were of the same tribe - My Fees last week amounted to $196 - I have now - $500 - recd since I arrived after paying all expenses weekly and $50 of the money I brought with me and besides have three months pay due which I shall get when I do to Memphis - I have but little to write about but miss you all so much - have not heard from Tommy and ? I cannot get the place in Alabama have to
Mrs WRHackley Your aff Husband WRHackley
